body:
These examples both fail to cythonize:

```cython
cdef extern from *:
    void *my_func[T]()

cdef extern from *:
    T *my_func[T]()
```

But this works fine:

```cython
cdef extern from *:
    void my_func[T]()

cdef extern from *:
    T my_func[T]()
```

This is the error output:

```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cdef extern from *:
    void *my_func[T]()
                  ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pyx:2:19: Template parameter not a type

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cdef extern from *:
    void *my_func[T]()

cdef extern from *:
    T *my_func[T]()
   ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pyx:5:4: 'T' is not a type identifier

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cdef extern from *:
    void *my_func[T]()

cdef extern from *:
    T *my_func[T]()
               ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pyx:5:16: Template parameter not a type
```
title: Template function declarations break if they are returning a pointer type
